title: Official:   An Extraordinary Exposition of the Holy Shroud in 2015
post: It ought to be obvious that it will be important for  the Shroud community to get its “stuff” together. It  appears the Turin conference and the St. Louis conference are perfectly timed for that. I just open the processes are open. I know we can trust Joe and his colleagues for that in St. Louis.
author: John Klotz

title: Official:   An Extraordinary Exposition of the Holy Shroud in 2015
post: It ought to be obvious that your manuscript will be very important. From the bits I’ve seen of your forthcoming book, it is more than obvious.
author: Dan

title: Official:   An Extraordinary Exposition of the Holy Shroud in 2015
post: It also means that petitions to the pontiff will be stored in a drawer and forgotten, at least till 2015.
author: Louis

title: Official:   An Extraordinary Exposition of the Holy Shroud in 2015
post: I think you are right and I don’t think that is a bad thing. What should we do in the meantime. Hold up on all proposals but take the time to fine tune them? Build bridges where we need to? Find skeptics who can help constructively to make sure proposals are not biased? I’m just thinking out load.
author: Dan

title: Official:   An Extraordinary Exposition of the Holy Shroud in 2015
post: Dan, we have the conferences in Bari and Saint Louis, both of which are bound to produce something new and even offer other proposals. As you said, fine tuning and the building of bridges will be needed. Sceptics will also be welcome, but as long as they are objective and don’t come with any anti-religious bias.
author: Louis
